events.title: "One River, Many Visions" Exhibit at the Seven Stars Gallery
events.venue_name: Nevada City Odd Fellows Seven Stars Gallery
events.description: Nine local artists celebrate our “back yard” part of the great atmospheric and oceanic river that flows around the globe. Exhibiting artists are: Gail Lipson, Denise Wey, Jeff Bousfield, Beth Leydon, Chic Lotz, Steve Curl, Miriam Morris, Risa Roseman, Juliette Williams, Inge Ivens, and Leah Ellis The artists reception is from 5:00 – 7:00 pm on Friday, February 13th. Regular gallery hours are: Thursdays – Sundays, from 11:00 am to 5:00 pm For questions or to contact the gallery, please click here
events.venue_address: Nevada City Odd Fellows Seven Stars Gallery, 210 Spring St., Nevada City, 95959

events.title: Carnaval a la Brazil: Nevada City Mardi Gras Fest at the Miners Foundry
events.description: Please come celebrate Nevada City Mardi Gras at the Carnaval a la Brazil from 11:00 am – 8:00 pm on Sunday, February 15th at the Miners Foundry in downtown Nevada City! Get ready to samba and shake your way through the ultimate Mardi Gras event filled with Brazilian flair and festive vibes! Step onto the dance floor, and lose yourself in the infectious rhythms of Mardi Gras and Brazilian Carnaval! Prepare for a dazzling celebration bursting with music, vibrant colors, and pure joy. Enjoy our aut
events.venue_address: Miners Foundry, 325 Spring Street, Nevada City, CA, 95959, United States

events.title: Gardens of Huemanity at Axis Gallery
events.description: Gardens of Huemanity by Delgreta Brown is an exploration of multiple environments — terrestrial, aquatic, celestial, and aerial. In a time where communities are challenged by the notion of belonging to society or lands, Delgreta Brown asserts that these vibrant, beautiful environments are enriched by an array of hues and inhabited by the African diaspora’s presence. Gardens of Huemanity is a visual and sensory effort to activate resilience. Delgreta depicts the African diaspora in these natural
events.venue_address: Axis Gallery, 625 S Street, Sacramento, CA, 95811, United States

events.title: Porcelain Ashtray at Axis Gallery
events.description: Friday, February 6th through Sunday, March 1st with regular gallery hours from noon t0 5:00 pm, Friday – Sunday. Second Saturday Reception from 5:00 – 8:00 pm on February 14th. Axis Gallery is pleased to present Porcelain Ashtray, an exhibition of new works by Sacramento-based artist Adam Cochran. Family slides taken in the 1950s, 60’s, and 70’s have been reworked and re-imagined as oil paintings, creating intimate moments of reflection and connection. With these paintings, Cochran has grappled
events.venue_address: Axis Gallery, 625 S Street, Sacramento, CA, 95811, United States

events.title: 2026 Mardi Gras Parade and Street Fair
events.description: Mardi Gras returns to Nevada City on Sunday, February 15th! This annual family-friendly event features a festive parade and street fair throughout historic downtown Nevada City, offering up spirited fun for all ages. Nevada City has been known to throw quite the party and its version of Fat Tuesday is no exception! The parade starts promptly at 2:00 pm, but festivities run all afternoon from noon to 4:00 pm. Back by popular demand, the Earles of Newtown will perform from the balcony on the corne
events.venue_address: Downtown Nevada City, Nevada City, CA, 95959, United States

events.title: Third Sunday Stringband Jam at Wild Eye Pub
events.description: Geff and Masha Crawford are joined by local musicians and friends playing old-time fiddle tunes, each third Sunday afternoon. Players and listeners are welcome. Old-time music has fiddle, banjo, mandolin, guitar, etc. and is from the days before radio, before bluegrass even. It’s traditional mountain music closely related to Irish/Celtic. Come listen, have lunch, have a drink; join in if you know the tunes, or just sit back and enjoy! *************************** About the venue: Wild Eye Pub is
events.venue_address: Wild Eye Pub, 535 Mill Street, Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: Earles of Newtown: Mardi Gras Parade After-Party at the Crazy Horse
events.description: From parade balconies to the stage of the Crazy Horse, the Earles of Newtown are mingling with the Mardi Gras spirits in electrifying fashion. This one-of-a-kind joy factory is still untouchable when it comes to gypsy jazz, speakeasy soul, and seductive blues. The eight-piece, vaudevillian-inspired, musical circus cross-pollinates both vintage and modern beat culture into an intoxicating, crowd-pleasing elixir. When you’re dancing recklessly to their sexy, back-alley grooves, you’ll straddle the
events.venue_address: Crazy Horse Saloon, 230 Commercial Street, Nevada City, CA, 95959, United States

events.title: Honey of the Heart at The Hearth: a House Concert and Culinary Evening
events.description: We’re opening the doors of The Hearth for a truly special night of music, movement, food, and connection. This is an intimate gathering — a private house concert experience, paired with the extraordinary food of Rene from Comedor GV, whose cooking is as soulful as it is delicious. Come solo, with a beloved, or with friends. Singles and couples are warmly welcome. This night is about presence, play, and opening the heart together. An optional afternoon experience is a Cocrea dance workshop with W
events.venue_address: The Hearth, (Address Given Upon Ticket Purchase), CA, United States

events.title: Nevada County Mardi Gras Show: From New Orleans, Lynn Drury at the Wild Eye
events.description: Wild Eye Pub welcomes New Orleans’ touring artist Lynn Drury for her Nevada County debut! Lynn’s joined by long-time local favorite, Bob Woods, as she delivers a playful dose of her Crescent City-infused original Americana genre of music. Please come out and give Lynn a warm welcome, Nevada County-style . . . you’ll be glad you did! What others are saying: “If rockers Joan Jett or Suzi Quatro ventured into country rock with a ballad, it may sound like this … Lynn Drury is an equally accomplished
events.venue_address: Wild Eye Pub, 535 Mill Street, Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: Downtempo Lounge with DJ Ronnie Beats at Elixart
events.description: Local vinyl aficionado and Lord of Chill, DJ Ronnie Beats will be bringing an all-vinyl downtempo set to Elixart from 7:00 – 10:00 pm for a sweet Sunday evening on February 15th. This set will have creamy relaxing beats and all the smooth grooves you need to enjoy your elixirs and conversations with locals, as well as tourists. This will be a new staple event here, because DJ Ronnie Beats always brings such a perfect conversational chill DJ vibe. Come chat deeply or jokingly with the wildest and
events.venue_address: Elixart, 203 York St., Nevada City, CA, 95959, United States

events.title: Beginning Yoga: Four-Week Class at Sierra College Community Education
events.description: Please join use for Beginning Yoga at Sierra College Community Education Nevada County Campus. This is a four-week class series that meets February 2nd through February 23rd, 2026 on Monday evenings from 5:30 – 6:30 pm. Explore the foundations of the practice of Yoga. Discover breathing exercises to expand lung capacity; yoga poses for strength, flexibility, and balance; and exercises for relaxation. There will be special attention placed on moving at a slow pace to notice, feel, and develop bod
events.venue_address: Sierra College Community Education, 250 Sierra College Dr., Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: Free Movie Night at Wild Eye Pub
events.description: Please join us for our next free movie night! Enjoy the films on our big screen with great Bose sound, comfy seating, and yummy options for food, drink, and popcorn. Doors are at 5:00 pm, the movie at 6:00 – including a brief midway intermission to refresh, reorder, and check your auction bids. We’re grateful to local movie reviewer and author Thomas Burchfield, who has been offering brief film introductions with key highlights to enhance the viewing experience. Our first movie night included a
events.venue_address: Wild Eye Pub, 535 Mill Street, Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: Nevada County Law Library's Noon-Time Legal Seminar Series: "Understanding Probate in California"
events.description: The Nevada County Law Library, in collaboration with the Madelyn Helling Library, continues its Noon-Time Legal Seminar Series by presenting a free session on Understanding Probate in California by local attorney Dylan Hendricks, from noon to 1:00 pm on Tuesday, February 17th. You may attend in person at the Madelyn Helling Library in Nevada City, or remotely via TEAMS. This seminar is geared towards the non-legal community, although everyone is welcome. Please note that a Minimum Continuing Leg
events.venue_address: Madelynn Helling Library, 980 Helling Way, Nevada City, Caliifornia

events.title: Love and Logic: "Magic for Early Childhood" Eight-Week Parenting Course
events.venue_name: Child Development Center at Sierra College Campus
events.description: This supportive class provides practical, effective strategies for raising young children with love, patience, and consistency. Discover proven solutions that help little ones to thrive while reducing stress for parents. For 48 years, Love and Logic has guided parents with simple, actionable tools to help manage early childhood challenges while building strong, loving relationships. Topics include: – Setting and keeping loving limits – Teaching young kids to listen the first time – Managing pott
events.venue_address: Child Development Center at Sierra College Campus, 250 Sierra College Drive, Grass Valley, 95945

events.title: Truckee Trivia Tuesdays at Alibi Ale Works
events.description: Truckee trivia Tuesdays! It just rolls right off the tongue, doesn’t it? Please come join our host, Craig, for a night full of brain busters and beer from 6:00 – 8:00 pm. Craig (the longest-standing trivia host in Truckee) creates all of the questions from scratch! So grab some friends and head over to Alibi Truckee for a chance to win a $50 Alibi gift card at our weekly Truckee Trivia.
events.venue_address: Alibi Ale Works – Truckee, 10069 Bridge Street, Truckee, CA, 96161, United States

events.title: Elixart Afterglow Presents: Davidos
events.description: David “Davidos” Cowie has done deep research into the vibe and atmosphere at Elixart. Even going so far as to marry one of the beloved bartenders/managers, so that he can better curate DJ sets for the bar! He brings an amazing blend of house/techno/acid styles that are cleanly blended for a clubby smoothie of beats sure to get your head nodding and booty rocking.
events.venue_address: Elixart, 203 York St., Nevada City, CA, 95959, United States

events.title: Bluegrass Jam Night at Uncle Sonny's Bar
events.description: Bluegrass open jam session every Wednesday from 6:00 – 8:00 pm. All pickers and singers welcome for pickin’, toe-tappin’ fun at Uncle Sonny’s Bar: 13475 Colfax Highway/174 Grass Valley, CA 95945
events.venue_address: Uncle Sonny’s Bar, 13475 Colfax Hwy, Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: Joss Stone at the Center for the Arts
events.description: Presented by the Center for the Arts from 7:00 – 10:00 pm (with doors opening at 6:00) on Wednesday, February 18th, 2026. Joss Stone is a Grammy and Brit Award-winning artist who released her acclaimed debut album, The Soul Sessions in 2003, at the age of 16. Over her career, she has released nine studio albums, selling over 15 million copies worldwide. Stone has performed and collaborated with legendary artists including: James Brown, Burt Bacharach, Stevie Wonder, Gladys Knight, Sting, Van Mor
events.venue_address: The Center for the Arts, 314 W. Main Street, Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: KylePalooza IV with Broken Compass Bluegrass at the Crazy Horse
events.description: Kyle Ledson has been playing the Crazy Horse since he was 18 years old. Three years ago, when he turned 21, we established this event affectionately known as KylePalooza. Now he’s practically an old man, as we prepare to celebrate the fourth annual birthday celebration for one of our favorite pickers and people. His band Broken Compass Bluegrass provides the adventurous soundtrack for the occasion. Somehow this won’t be just another “ordinary” BCB show. The birthday boy calls the shots, and we’l
events.venue_address: Crazy Horse Saloon, 230 Commercial Street, Nevada City, CA, 95959, United States

events.title: Nevada County Cannabis Alliance Webinar: Using Local Policy to Scale Your Cannabis Business
events.description: Over the past decade, The Nevada County Cannabis Alliance has advanced fair and equitable policies that support our local licensed cannabis industry. In this webinar, Executive Director of the Cannabis Alliance, Diana Gamzon, will teach you how to utilize these policies to strengthen, expand, and protect your business in a competitive market. Discover the key local policy wins and how to turn them into real opportunities for your farm or brand. Please join us online for the free webinar: “Using
events.venue_address: Bodhi Hive, 420 Providence Mine Road, Nevada City, CA, 95959, United States

events.title: Acoustic Jam and Open Mic Night at the Wild Eye
events.description: After a few songwriter requests, we’re planning on having this acoustic jam and open mic night more often, at least a couple of Thursdays per month. We’ll have various hosts; this week, local songwriter Robby Robinson will be the host. This open mic welcomes songwriters, acoustic jammers, and players from music’s softer side. The pub has a PA, lights, and some instruments, or bring yours. Come by and play, or just listen. Doors open at 5:00 pm. No cover – but donations are welcome. _____________
events.venue_address: Wild Eye Pub, 535 Mill Street, Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: Open Jam Night at Gold Vibe Kombuchary
events.description: Calling all musicians, singers, and music lovers! Join us every first and third Thursday from 6:00 – 8:30 pm for Open Jam Night at Gold Vibe Kombuchary in Grass Valley, where creativity, collaboration, and live music come to life! Whether you’re an experienced performer, a budding artist, or just love live music, this is your chance to take the stage, connect with fellow musicians, and enjoy a night of incredible talent. What to Expect: – All musicians and genres welcome: solo acts, bands, and s
events.venue_address: Gold Vibe Kombuchary, 12615 Charles Drive, Grass Valley, CA, 95949, United States

events.title: The Doo Wop Project at the Center for the Arts
events.description: The Doo Wop Project brings the classic sounds of vocal harmony into the 21st century. Featuring stars from Broadway hits like Jersey Boys, Motown, and Beautiful, this supergroup takes audiences on a journey from the golden age of street-corner harmonies to modern hits “Doo Wop-ified” with their signature style. With a PBS special, four albums, and sold-out shows worldwide, the Doo Wop Project delights every generation with music that’s timeless and fresh. 7:00 – 9:00 pm on Thursday, February 19t
events.venue_address: The Center for the Arts, 314 W. Main Street, Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: NU Dance: 25th Annual Student Choreography Showcase
events.venue_name: Nevada Union High School – Don Baggett Theatre
events.description: Nevada Union High School’s Theatrical Dance program proudly presents the 25th annual Student Choreography Showcase on Thursday, February 19th through Saturday, February 21st from 7:00 – 9:00 p.m. at the Don Baggett Theater, 11761 Ridge Road in Grass Valley. Twenty student choreographers have created dances in a variety of styles, taught to their peers in after-school and weekend rehearsals. Junior Tabby Gillespie is choreographing for the first time this year, and she chose “Benny and the Jets”
events.venue_address: Nevada Union High School – Don Baggett Theatre, 11761 Ridge Road, Nevada City, CA, 95959, United States

events.title: Sans Backup Plan Records Live Music Event: Living Hour, Rosemother, and Davia
events.description: Please join us for an evening of live music featuring: Living Hour, an indie rock band touring from Canada; Rosemother, a Sacramento-based dream pop band; as well as local Nevada City artist, Davia, from 7:00 to 10:00 pm on Thursday, February 19th at Sans Backup Plan Records, 748 Zion Street, Suite A in Nevada City. It’s an all-ages event on a sliding scale admission basis!
events.venue_address: Sans Backup Plan Records, 748 Zion Street, #A, Nevada City, CA, 95959, United States

events.title: Band Beyond Description: Bob Weir Tribute, the Sequel
events.description: News Flash! Our Bob Weir tribute back on January 15th was such a lightning rod event for the community, that we have decided once was not enough. Instead of placing the full focus on Mardi Gras, as we initially intended with this event, we are going for round two in paying our respects to Bobby. The man was such a huge influence on so many of our lives, and thus deserves an even deeper dive into his music. The band won’t be repeating any songs played last time.
